title: Database
description: This schema defines the Database entity. A database also referred to as Database Catalog is a collection of schemas.

entityName.description: Name of a table. Expected to be unique within a database.

id.description: Unique identifier that identifies this database instance.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Name that uniquely identifies a database in the format 'ServiceName.DatabaseName'.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this database.

dataProducts.description: List of data products this entity is part of.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to this entity.

service.description: Link to the database cluster/service where this database is hosted in.

serviceType.description: Service type where this database is hosted in.

location.description: Reference to the Location that contains this database.

usageSummary.description: Latest usage information for this database.

databaseSchemas.description: References to schemas in the database.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

default.description: Some databases don't support a database/catalog in the hierarchy and use default database. For example, `MySql`. For such databases, set this flag to true to indicate that this is a default database.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.

retentionPeriod.description: Retention period of the data in the database. Period is expressed as duration in ISO 8601 format in UTC. Example - `P23DT23H`.

extension.description: Entity extension data with custom attributes added to the entity.

domain.description: Domain the Database belongs to. When not set, the Database inherits the domain from the database service it belongs to.

lifeCycle.description: Life Cycle properties of the entity
